# Basic Layouts

## Grouped Lists

::: {.nonincremental}
::: {.tightlist .grouped}

    -   2nd level will appear with top level
-   Another 1st level bullet
    -   Another 2nd level bullet

:::

::: notes

This slide template uses grouped lists to show multiple levels of bullet points at once.

Depends on javascript in the bubbles.js theme file.

List must be wrapped in a non-incremental div.

:::

# Code Blocks

## Simple Animated Block (Non-executable)

```{.r code-line-numbers="|1-2|4-5|7-8"}
# Fragment 1
fragment 1 <- "example code"

# Fragment 2
fragment 2 <- "example code"

# Fragment 3
fragment 3 <- "example code"

```

::: notes

Non-executable code block.

All text visible initially, then fragments revealed in three steps.

:::

#### Example non-executable code for animation

Everything begins grayed out.

```{.r}
inner_join(
  x,
  y,
  by = NULL,
  copy = FALSE,
  suffix = c(".x", ".y"),
  ...,
  keep = NULL
)

left_join(
  x,
  y,
  by = NULL,
  copy = FALSE,
  suffix = c(".x", ".y"),
  ...,
  keep = NULL
)
```

:::

::::

:::::

::: notes

This slide template uses the codefocus plugin to highlight specific lines of code in sync with corresponding list items.

Each list item is a fragment that highlights specific lines in the code block when revealed.

The code block is styled with a border and background color to distinguish it from the rest of the slide content.

:::
